raw: Southwest posts first quarterly loss in nine years, shores up cash to weather pandemic .
replaced: Southwest posts first quarterly loss in nine years, shores up cash to weather pandemic .

raw: By Tracy Rucinski
replaced: By Tracy Rucinski

raw: ( Reuters ) - Southwest Airlines Co on Tuesday posted a $ 94 million quarterly net loss , its first in nine years , and warned of drastic revenue drops ahead as it sought to raise another $ 2.6 billion to help weather the coronavirus pandemic .
replaced: ( Reuters ) - Southwest Airlines Co on Tuesday posted a $ 94 million quarterly net loss , Reuters ) - Southwest Airlines Co first in nine years , and warned of drastic revenue drops ahead as Reuters ) - Southwest Airlines Co sought to raise another $ 2.6 billion to help weather The coronavirus outbreak .

raw: Its shares opened down 1 % at $ 28.82 after it announced a public stock offering of 55 million shares , worth around $ 1.6 billion at Monday ’s closing price of $ 29.11 , and $ 1 billion worth of convertible debt .
replaced: Reuters ) - Southwest Airlines Co shares opened down 1 % at $ 28.82 after Reuters ) - Southwest Airlines Co announced a public stock offering of 55 million shares , worth around $ 1.6 billion at Monday ’s closing price of $ 29.11 , and $ 1 billion worth of convertible debt .

raw: The COVID-19 crisis has decimated travel demand , with unprecedented flight cancellations in the second half of March , forcing airlines to preserve and raise cash .
replaced: The COVID-19 crisis has decimated travel demand , with unprecedented flight cancellations in the second half of March , forcing airlines to preserve and raise cash .

raw: Dallas - based Southwest swung to a net loss of $ 94 million for the quarter ended March 31 , compared to a profit of $ 387 million a year earlier .
replaced: Southwest swung to a net loss of $ 94 million for the quarter ended March 31 , compared to a profit of $ 387 million a year earlier  Sept. 30 , compared to a profit of $ 387 million a year earlier .

raw: Excluding special items , the loss was $ 77 million , or a $ 0.15 loss per share .
replaced: Excluding special items , a net loss of $ 94 million for the quarter ended March 31 , compared to a profit of $ 387 million a year earlier was $ 77 million , or a $ 0.15 loss per share .

raw: Total operating revenue fell 17.8 % to $ 4.2 billion .
replaced: Total operating revenue fell 17.8 % to $ 4.2 billion .

raw: It sees operating revenue falling by 90 - 95 % in both April and May , when it does not expect load factors to surpass 10 % .
replaced: Southwest sees operating revenue falling by 90 - 95 % in both April and May , when Southwest does not expect load factors to surpass 10 % .

raw: While the airline has more bookings for June and July - albeit in a drastically reduced flight schedule - it said it can not reasonably estimate any revenue trends beyond May.
replaced: While Southwest has more bookings for June and July - albeit in a drastically reduced flight schedule - Southwest said Southwest can not reasonably estimate any revenue trends beyond May.

raw: " We have no idea what kind of cancellations will come through before those travel dates ; there 's no way to be comfortable with what will happen to those reservations , " Southwest CEO Gary Kelly told Reuters .
replaced: " Southwest have no idea what kind of cancellations will come through before those travel dates ; there 's no way to be comfortable with what will happen to those reservations , " Southwest  Kelly told Reuters .

raw: The coronavirus outbreak has led to the deaths of more than 207,000 people , including more than 55,000 in the United States , a Reuters tally shows .
replaced: The coronavirus outbreak has led to the deaths of more than 207,000 people , including more than 55,000 in the United States , a Reuters tally shows .

raw: Stay - at - home orders remain in place across much of the world and it is an open question as to when people will feel comfortable traveling again and under what safety requirements .
replaced: Stay - at - home orders remain in place across much of the world and it is an open question as to when people will feel comfortable traveling again and under what safety requirements .

raw: Airlines including Southwest support pre - boarding temperature checks , face masks and social distancing measures on airplanes and in airports .
replaced: Airlines including Southwest support pre - boarding temperature checks , face masks and social distancing measures on airplanes and in airports .

raw: " We do think there 's a role for the federal government to play here and as an industry we 'll be advocating for that , " Kelly said .
replaced: " Southwest do think there that a role for the federal government to play here and as an industry Southwest 'll be advocating for that , " Kelly said .

raw: Southwest 's average daily cash burn will slow to between $ 30 million and $ 35 million in the second quarter , due to a series of cost - cutting measures and capital raisings , including government aid , it said .
replaced: Southwest average daily cash burn will slow to between $ 30 million and $ 35 million in the second quarter , due to a series of cost - cutting measures and capital raisings , including government aid , Southwest said .

raw: The airline is receiving about $ 3.3 billion in government payroll support and said it was considering tapping an additional $ 2.8 billion in secured government loans under the stimulus package known as the CARES Act , among other liquidity options .
replaced: Southwest is receiving about $ 3.3 billion in government payroll support and said Southwest was considering tapping an additional $ 2.8 billion in secured government loans under the stimulus package known as the CARES Act , among other liquidity options .

raw: It had $ 9.3 billion in cash and short - term investments as of April 24 , with leverage of 47 % .
replaced: Southwest had $ 9.3 billion in cash and short - term investments as of April 24 , with leverage of 47 % .

raw: Under the terms of government payroll support , airlines can not lay off employees before Sept. 30 .
replaced: Under the terms of government payroll support , airlines can not lay off employees before Sept. 30 .

raw: If demand remains weak , Southwest has said it may need to reduce its workforce after that date and rethink its fleet .
replaced: If demand remains weak , Southwest has said Southwest may need to reduce Southwest workforce after that date and rethink Southwest  its fleet .

raw: Southwest , which only operates Boeing 737s and is the world 's largest customer of the grounded 737 MAX , said it has reached an agreement with Boeing Co to take no more than 48 new 737 MAX jets until Dec. 2021 , a fraction of the 123 it had originally scheduled .
